Description: Textile fragment; one end of a torn strip of linen cloth, medium quality, undyed, now buff-coloured with darker stains. Remains of a plain warp fringe. At 30cm in from this, a group of self-bands (two thin self-bands, two thicker self-bands, two plain picks, two thicker self-bands). Edges torn, second end cut ? The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spliced and S-twisted; the stitch gauge is warp c.21 ends per 10mm and weft c.9-10 picks per 10mm. The warp fringe is without twists or knots; sides are torn and the second end is cut.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville
Acquisition notes: EA 75997-75999 and 76001 were all wrapped in paper labelled in ink in a 19th century hand, 'Mummy Rollers', and in pencil 'Dr Granville'. Probably from the mummy of Irtyersenu, unwrapped by A B Granville in 1821.
